intro: Seseli ponticum, commonly known as Pontic seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves that are often finely divided. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and Western Asia, including parts of Turkey and the Balkans. Seseli ponticum is often found in open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
